bibl.title: Letter from Jesse W. Lazear to Charlotte C. Sweitzer, March 13, 1900

div1.p: Lazear describes the camp location and commanders. He offers his opinion of Cubans and reports that Mabel Lazear will leave for the United States before the fever season quarantine begins.

div1.head: Letter from Jesse W. Lazear to Charlotte C. Sweitzer, March 13, 1900
div1.opener:
DR. JESSE W. LAZEAR
836 PARK AVE.
OFFICE HOURS,
4.30-6 P. M.
Columbia Barracks
Havana Cuba
BALTIMORE. March 13 1900
My dear Mother,
div1.p:
I received your letter of March 4.
I thought I had explained the position of
the barracks. We are eight miles west
of Havana and about a half a mile
from the town of Marianao, which is a
long struggling affair having several
sep names for different parts. One part is
called Quemados and this is the headquarters
of the division of Havana and Pinar del Rio.
General Fitzhugh Lee is in command and he has
of course a large staff of his own.
The headquarters is in a large palace which
belongs to a rich Spanish nobleman. It
is one of the most beautiful buildings in
the island. Colonel Wood whom we knew
in California is chief Commisary officer.
Mrs. Wood with Mrs. Lee called on Mabel.
We went to the palace in town to the
reception given by Gen Wood to Mr. Root.
All the officers about here were present
On Saturday a review of the troops here
was held for Mr Root. It was quite
a spectacle

I cannot say much as yet about the
DR. JESSE W. LAZEAR
835 PARK AVE.
OFFICE HOURS,
4.30-6 P. M.
BALTIMORE.
work. I do only the laboratory part and
I have full swing there. There is
plenty to keep me busy and much that is
very interesting.

The first effects of the change of climate have
now worn off and I find myself
as energetic as at home. I arrange
to get in a good deal of work early in
the morning. I am in the laboratory by
eight o'clock. They have built us a very
nice porch on our house and put
up shelves and other conveniences.

The mess is fairly good. The meat is
excellent. It is brought an ice from
Chicago. We have some fresh vegetables
but not as much as we should.

Everything will grow here but the Cubans
are too lazy to try. The best gardens
are kept by Chinese.

The Dr. Walker you speak of is all right
I think. He is uncouth murders the King's
English etc but I believe he is a good
surgeon and he should succeed among
the lower and middle classes.
Mabel will probably not stay much longer

DR. JESSE W. LAZEAR,
835 PARK AVE.

She will have to go before the Quarantine
begins. as in If not, she would
have to remain outside New York for
several days and have her clothes
spoiled in the disinfecting process.

She will go on a transport ask that will
be much cheaper.
